snippet: Lawmakers granted a Hong Kong company the right to build a $40 billion cross-country shipping canal that could compete with the Panama Canal if it is ever built.
abstract: Nicaraguan lawmakers grant Hong Kong company right to build $40-billion cross-country shipping canal that could compete with Panama Canal, moving one step closer to fulfilling national dream; experts question whether plan will come to fruition, citing challenges of environmental opposition, changes in shipping patterns and construction costs.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers granted a Hong Kong company the right to build a $40 billion cross-country shipping canal that could compete with the Panama Canal if it is ever built.

headline.main: Nicaragua Approves Building Its Own Canal
headline.print_headline: Nicaragua Approves Building Its Own Canal

keywords.value: HK Nicaragua Canal Development Investment Co
keywords.name: organizations
